H0.text: In the Bible, where was Jesus betrayed by Judas, and subsequently arrested. Mount of Olives

H1.text: In the Bible, where was Jesus betrayed by Judas, and subsequently arrested. Jerusalem Temple

H2.text: In the Bible, where was Jesus betrayed by Judas, and subsequently arrested. Bethany

H3.text: In the Bible, where was Jesus betrayed by Judas, and subsequently arrested. Gethsemane

A4.text: Gethsemane is a garden at the foot of the Mount of Olives in East Jerusalem, where, according to the four Gospels of the New Testament, Jesus Christ underwent the Agony in the Garden and was arrested before his crucifixion.

A5.text: According to the New Testament the garden was a place that Jesus and his disciples customarily visited, which allowed Judas Iscariot to find him on the night Jesus was arrested.
